intro: Gomphichis psilosepala, commonly known as the narrow-sepaled gomphichis, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its slender, branched stems and small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in arid or semi-arid environments, often in rocky soils, and is adapted to withstand drought conditions. Its flowers are usually pale green to yellowish in color, and it produces small, dry fruits that contain seeds. Gomphichis psilosepala is a perennial herb that plays a role in local ecosystems by providing nectar for pollinators and habitat for small invertebrates.
